name: StoreKit
slogan: A better way to buy POS
description:
A better way to buy POS. Sell more in-store, online and on-the-go with StoreKit. Storekit supplies point-of-sale hardware, accessories, software selection advice and payment processing to small and medium size merchants.

In more details...

StoreKit.com is a platform for the point-of-sale (POS) industry. POS is what allows merchants to run their business and accept payments in their store, restaurant etc. The POS market is undergoing a massive transition towards more efficient, cloud based systems. iZettle and Square are the big names but only a small part of what is happening out there. While competition is intense between sellers, the offering remains complex/confusing for the buyers who end up buying the wrong things. It's a broken market.

StoreKit solves this by helping merchants choose the right tech and partners with the major software and payment companies to help them grow their customer base.

jobs.title: Ecommerce Assistant
jobs.description:
**About us**

StoreKit is an ecommerce store and software marketplace aimed at stores. (To us, a "store" is anywhere with a till).

We're bringing much-needed transparency to an opaque and customer-unfriendly industry.

Our mission is to help small business owners make the best choice when buying their in-store technology. That generally means their tills – which are comprised of Point-of-Sale software, a payment processing contract, and hardware. We get paid through both direct hardware sales and referrals to our software and payment partners.

We're a small and close team, have been profitable from day one (~2 years ago), have not yet taken outside investment and with a solid foundation, we're now scaling into a higher growth period.

As we look to grow the hardware ecommerce revenue to £5M and beyond, we’re looking for an ecommerce assistant to join the team and be part of our success.

**The role**

For StoreKit to run like clockwork we need sound support behind the scenes – and that’s where you come in. Based in our Regent Street office, you will provide a top-notch assistant and administrative service that will support our team’s success.

You'll work closely with the team to perform daily ecommerce and admin tasks. Reporting to the Head of ecommerce, you'll be working across different areas of the business.

There will also be plenty of opportunity to learn new skills across ecommerce technology and systems, operations & logistics and customer service.

**About you**

You should be keen to learn more about ecommerce and willing to learn on the job quickly. We use a number of different systems and processes that are still changing as we learn and adapt. You'll need to pick things up quickly and be able to work autonomously at times.

No experience in our industry? Not a problem. We will train you so you understand how our business works and the products we offer. All we ask is that you’re efficient, approachable, thorough and great in a team – a skilled assistant who’s flexible and understands the changing needs of the business.

Responsibilities:

- Be the first point of contact for inbound (phone, email & live chat) customer enquiries
- Supporting the eCommerce team with admin tasks across multiple online stores
- Raising purchase orders, invoices and communicating with our suppliers
- Upload, maintain and create onsite product content
- General administration tasks
- Occasional warehouse related tasks such as order packing, stock receiving and audit
- Ensuring meetings and communal spaces remain tidy and equipped
- Processing customer returns & liaising with manufacturers
- Helping define our mid and long-term eCommerce product roadmap

Previous experience working in ecommerce or a tech startup is a big plus, but not required. Fluent English is a requirement, and any other European languages, especially French will be helpful.

Please note that any applications submitted without a covering letter and CV will not be considered for the role.
